bibl.seg: Helene P. Foley, Performing Gender in Greek Old and New Comedy.
Martin Revermann (ed.), The Cambridge Companion to Greek Comedy (Cambridge, 2014) pp. 259-274.

Comedy's parody of serious literature, including tragedy, probably influenced old comic plots giving central roles to women and eventuated in New Comedy's more extensive borrowing from the tragic repertory, especially the plays of Euripides, although its plots focused on domestic rather than public issues.
